lines.text: My friend we don't sail on no tide.
Huh?
We got no crew.
But you told me you had a crew!
That's for true. This morning I have crew. You see them boys? Best crew in whole world. I steal them from Boston Man. Now, no crew! Boston Man steal them back... I think he is a thief.
When the Portugee make a deal it's a deal!
...As for your countess Solaniva, you can tell the 'ol wench she can swim to Alaska for all I care.
Be sure to tell her to take the inland passage, we don't want her to scare the seals.
Let's see what part of Russia you come from.
[leans in to kiss her]

[moving away]
Not from that part.
Oh?
Perhaps, not so quickly. In my part of Russia it is the custom to at least ask the girl's name before you kiss her.
Oh... Well, you see, in America we kiss first and ask later.
We *shall* be married!
After the hanging? Or before?

[indicating the Portugee]
Er, this gentleman is with your party?

This gentleman is no gentleman. He's a sea-going thief who makes his living stealing seals from the Russians. He neither bathes, shaves, nor knows the feel of good clean linen. When the moon is bright, he stays out all night and howls like a dog, then curls up and sleeps on the floor till midday. That right, Portugee?
He knows me pretty good.
Hey, you... you? How you like to sign on as first mate, huh?
Cast off, Portugee. For as vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes, so is the sound of your voice to the ears of an honest man.
Did it amuse you? Did it make you laugh to have a common American seaman ask you to marry him?
I advise you to find a crew within 48 hours. I'm not a man to be trifled with.
Me, I don't trifle with men either.
[repeated line]
We go!
